website_summaries.verdict: Unobtrusive charcoal-colored fiberglass screen, for DIY application to windows or doors.
pros: Popular item, can be used for either windows or doors
A subtle charcoal color, constructed of lightweight fiberglass
Medium range mesh size, so there is reasonable visibility through the screen
Generous quantity of screen material in the roll, can use in several windows
cons: Screen material only, no frame, so more work to install and have to purchase frame separately

customer_reviews.title: Not using in a window, works for our needs
customer_reviews.text: Not using in a window. We lined the back deck of my 2nd story condo unit with this as a way to keep my chihuahua from being able to squeeze out between the rails to the main steps and run away (again). It works great for our needs and keeps my pup safe at home. He can sun bathe on the porch to his heart's content ❤ 🐶!
customer_reviews.author: JNIY_T

customer_reviews.title: Great material!
customer_reviews.text: This was probably the best idea to try and keep mosquitoes out of my house. We were getting more than 20 at a time and it was not from going in or out of the house. I even covered the bottom crack of my bedroom door and kept it shut to find more pesky mosquitoes in my bedroom. I honestly think they were entering through the a/c vents even though my husband's says it is sealed. No more pesky mosquitoes thanks to this brilliant idea and amazing screen. I just got glued the screens onto the sides.
customer_reviews.author: LaineTop Contributor: Makeup

customer_reviews.title: Great for raised garden bed surround screen!
customer_reviews.text: I used this to wrap around my raised garden bed to keep out the kitties and other nibbling creatures. Just nailed it onto a couple of 1x2s to make a quick frame. It was a bit tall when if was mounted flush to the edge of the bed, so I lowered it to the ground and now we can easily reach over and into the garden while keeping out critters.
customer_reviews.author: Sj773Top Contributor: Gardening

customer_reviews.title: Great screens for planters.
customer_reviews.text: I can't speak on it's intended propose since I use it to cover drain holes in my planters. This is awesome for that. It helps keep the soil in your pots when you water plants. And its much cheaper than buying those precut drain covers.
customer_reviews.author: Casices

customer_reviews.title: Looks beautiful--Not "OK" for pets
customer_reviews.text: This screen looks beautiful when installed and installation was relatively easy. The listing in Amazon includes a table showing the usages of their product. It indicates this product is "OK" for pets--it's not. Soon after I re-screened the whole house Beau, my mischievous tabby hooked his claw in one of the screens and tore some of the fiber. If you don't have cats I think this would be a great product if it is installed in places where dogs cannot get close to it. It is not OK for a house with cats.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Liked the yardage for my project
customer_reviews.text: Yeah! Needed yardage for my project and couldn't get it in stores so thank you to Amazon for carrying this. Can't give it five stars because product is very thin and may not hold up thru the weather in wisconsin, but couldn't afford the pet version of screening. Hand stitched two rows together since I couldn't find width as well as the length I needed but so far is working out. Will see if it tears from staples in the wind or from the cats chasing bugs that land on the screen. The cats are happy for now.
customer_reviews.author: AlleyCat

customer_reviews.title: HAS MORE USES THAN WINDOWS
customer_reviews.text: My wife uses this on the floor grate air return for our HVAC. It keeps out debris that would otherwise settle in the bottom of our duct work. An excellent use for this product that wasn't intended by the manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: Georgia Guy

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: 100% as is, as described by the seller. I took it to India, bcz we dont get such product over there. Fits and worked perfectly.. Seller should start selling this in India and it will be instant hit. back in India we use thin metal net (they call it stainless steel but it isn't) which is heavy, not at all good and in Indian humid weather it corrodes but this net is exactly opposite and thats what I was looking for. I dont wanted to go with Nylon so I chose Fiberglass Net. I must say, seller mailed this product carefully in a good and sturdy package. I will buy this product again for my 2nd home project.
customer_reviews.author: ROSHAN

customer_reviews.title: Great for pool net
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace the screen on my pool net frames. I didn’t want to pay $10 or more for a new net because just the fibers had broken. I pulled all of the old fibers out of the net, rolled out this screen, and drew the outline on the new screen with a marker. I cut it out, then used hot glue to glue it onto the screen. I trimmed it and I have an excellent new net. And now I have a whole ROLL of new “net” material in case my kids break it again! Win!!
customer_reviews.author: LovnLif79

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Worked excellent Fort my patio, screen my porch, easy to work with, awesome product.
customer_reviews.author: romeo girba

customer_reviews.title: Nicely heavy.
customer_reviews.text: I had to fix all but one of the thirteen screens on my sun porch... again. Last time it cost me a fortune, this time I did it myself! (Monster dog and wind damage) This screen was thicker than what I had paid big money for last time they'd been fixed... and easier to work with than the few that still had wire screen in them. I will buy again when I get ready to do the ones in the back of the house.
customer_reviews.author: PA Lady

customer_reviews.title: This screen is excellent
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I was looking for. I am replacing the screen on am 8 sided gazebo so I ordered this screen. I have replace half of them and it has gotten so hot outside, I decided to come inside and write my review. Everything about this screen is right for my job. It is consistent in width, 48", the weave is perfect, every thread is properly spaced. It is made of a durable materiel that doesn't rip and presses into the grove and stays there while i install the spline. A nice tight fit.
customer_reviews.author: Domn8or

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Use at an Affordable Price
customer_reviews.text: This is easy to use and comes in a size that works for many popular window sizes. I like it better than aluminum screen which isn't forgiving if you mess up when installing the spline. In addition to my primary purpose of replacing a torn window screen, I used some of the remaining screen to put in the bottom of flower pots and planters that have drainage holes to help keep soil in the pot and a piece as a strainer for leftover paint. I also used some as a base on a wooden open bird feeder I built - keeps seeds dry by letting the water drain away when it rains.
customer_reviews.author: The Bean Counter

customer_reviews.title: This was a great buy at $10
customer_reviews.text: I bought several of the 36" x 25' rolls for less than $10 a roll over the last couple of years. It was easy to work with, good quality, no defects. I don't use it for window screens. I sew it into bags to use for oyster spat. Now when I come back to repurchase, it is $30 a roll. I found another brand with very good reviews for a 36" x 100' roll for $40. That's what I'm buying this time. Although I am typically brand loyal when I find a good product, I am not going to pay 3 times the price if there is a viable alternative.
customer_reviews.author: Susan DeWalt

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for our screened in porch
customer_reviews.text: Just the ticket. With this screening, a staple gun, some screws, and some varnished pine, I turned part of our porch into an open-air writing den. It took a week or so, but that's only because I'm a klutz, and the screen gave me no trouble at all. (The varnish is another thing...) It's easy to work with and trims to size like good wrapping paper: just put some tension on it, start the cut with sharp scissors, then just push the open scissors along and the screen parts without drama, zipper-like.
customer_reviews.author: David Cortner

customer_reviews.title: Great....but did nit use for assumed purpose
customer_reviews.text: Funny enough I didnt purchase this to be used as a window screen. I use this as light duty mesh to avoid pea gravel sized rocks from clogging up the cracks in the top of my fountain basin or getting into my water pump inside said basin. Which of course since it's not holding any physical weight of rocks, the screen is holding up well .
customer_reviews.author: Drew

customer_reviews.title: Ripped
customer_reviews.text: Put the screen on the screen door and as I'm putting it on it ripped it says that it's supposed to be pet resistant as well I'm glad that I didn't put it up in my cats put their claws in it for some reason and it rip completely and they get out would not recommend. A little disappointed with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Tricia N.

customer_reviews.title: Very workable product
customer_reviews.text: This screen is very easy to work with as it is flexible. I am using this screen to put over the top of planters and flower pots which contain newly planted seeds. The reason for this is to keep birds and squirrels from eating my seedlings. I simply cut a piece to fit the container then use zip ties to tighten the screen together. It works very well as I can still water through the screen and have solved a problem at a low cost. Thanks to seller and prompt shipping.
customer_reviews.author: Peedy

customer_reviews.title: Very Happy With Results
customer_reviews.text: If you bought the frames, I would recommend these for the actual screens. I was able to do 2 windows (check your sizes) off of one roll, so that was nice. The material is noticeably strong, and while not as "see through" as the "clear advantage" version of this product that I got for my master room, it is more than satisfactory on all the other windows I set these up at. I have no worries these will last years and years, very happy. Highly Recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Ted Green

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for I reckon
customer_reviews.text: I like that there is a lot in the roll and for the price you cant beat it but I wish I had ordered a little heavy duty screen. I have cats trying to burgle my house when the windows are open so I bought this to replace some torn screens which id did but the damn cats have already torn it again. Good thing there is a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Randall

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I got this to make a diy screen for our sun room. The windows of the house we bought were painted shut years ago. My husband and I chiseled one open but we were getting all sorts of bugs because the screens were long gone. I ordered this and a few other things and easily cut out a piece big enough to cover the window and frame and put it up. It's working brilliantly. It's held up quite well against very high winds and our toddler pushing on it pretty regularly. I will be ordering more for another project that will take a significant amount of screen.
customer_reviews.author: Jenna

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Used this for a single screen door - perfect size! I had done a few windows before and bought the large rolls because I wanted extra in case I messed up, but this time I thought I had enough confidence not to mess up. Anyway it was perfect for the side to side length, and had a bit extra on the tops to bottoms. Looks nice, and is thicker than my last one while still letting in lots of light. Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install and seems durable
customer_reviews.text: Used this product to replace a screen on my kitchen window. Install process was very easy with a spline rolling tool. Fiberglass is much more malleable and forgiving than aluminum screen, which gave me more confidence in completing the job without issue.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Watch a few YouTube videos & get ‘er done!
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Screens were surprisingly easy to install with the tool & spline. Replaced three panels of torn screens in my screened porch in less than one hour (included removing panel, old spline & screen, adding new screen & spline, and reinstalling panel). Still have plenty in the roll of screen if I need to replace any other screen panels.
customer_reviews.author: amazonfan

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install, nearly invisible once installed
customer_reviews.text: replaced all screening on a large screened porch with this screen. This material was very easy to install with staples - I ran the roll the entire length of each side, then cut with household scissors to length. It cuts almost like wrapping paper - you can slide scissors down the fabric to cut, don't need to "chop". Once installed, it looks nearly invisible.
customer_reviews.author: Small Business Owner

customer_reviews.title: I am very happy with my purchase
customer_reviews.text: This is the same fiberglass screen material I purchased at a hardware supply store for more money. It is strong yet wrinkle resistant. It arrived in a durable Amazon box that protected the roll perfectly. I am very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Tombrello

customer_reviews.title: key to cheap screen house
customer_reviews.text: I'm using this to make a screen house for me to sit outside in and read. this is great. it cuts easily drapes nice and is easy to see out of and enjoy my creek. I may end up buying more and expand my bug less area. I'm attaching it to PVC with zip ties but think it would staple well. I did have one little bit of bunching when I tried to treat it like fabric and rip it the last bit when I hadn't cut the last inch or so. but I straightened it out - and that was strictly user error.
customer_reviews.author: Karen D

customer_reviews.title: Covers BEAN SPROUT jars
customer_reviews.text: Got this for growing sprouts in a jar. Some of the types of sprout seeds are very small. This keeps even the smallest in my jars.
customer_reviews.author: TOB9595

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money and effort.
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful screen replacement. Even though it was a little bit of work installing it was well worth it. It does look dark when you’re first installing, but when it is all done and put back in the sliding door it looks great and you can’t tell looking towards the outside that it is darker. I think it even helps keep it a little cooler in the house as well.
customer_reviews.author: C. R. Dean

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to work with
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to cut and fit. I enclosed a front porch to my wood posts. Lay it out on the floor, folded it to where I wanted the cut, paper clip it evenly on both sides and open the scissors and score it. I used penny nails on both sides of my wood posts and then staple gunned it across top and bottom. I will use 1 inch trim board to hide the edges and voila! I now have cut the sun in my front windows by 90 percent. Can't feel the heat on the carpet.
customer_reviews.author: AussiegirlIngridTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Great for my needs.
customer_reviews.text: I use this screen for repotting my orchids and patio plants. It’s perfect over the drain holes to prevent planting material from washing out and it doesn’t rust. Great for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Linda K. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: As advertised. Used to replace screens torn by hurricane in FL. Temporary, as whole cage needs to be replaced in a few months. Easy to use. Somewhat lightweight, I suspect only designed for about 7 year durability, but unsure. No bug issues since replaced. Similar to my last mesh, which never allowed no-see-ums, either.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Really Great Product for the price. I promise.
customer_reviews.text: This Fiberglass Screen is fantastic. No Lie,...it is really sturdy, cuts well, and has great strength. It looks really great in my door. (I have a nice, new, screen door with panes that go up and down. Not like those metal doors you see, really nice screen door.) I will definitely refer this product to others and highly, personally, recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Blessed 1

customer_reviews.title: Great price, fantastic quality!
customer_reviews.text: This is incredibly strong. I had replaced some of our screens and had a strip that was about 5 inches across left over, so I put a small cut in it and asked my husband to test the strength. He tried with all his might to tear it, and he couldn't. Our new screens will hold up for quite some time.
customer_reviews.author: MamaRae85

customer_reviews.title: Perfect stuff and unbeatable price
customer_reviews.text: We have a very large screen door and it’s hard to find replacement screen that is large enough. Home Depot has one option and it was $40! This is quality stuff and was easy to install. Does not have the smell some people were complaining about, but it’s also outside so maybe it has aired out?
customer_reviews.author: K.Lorenz

customer_reviews.title: looks nice
customer_reviews.text: looks nice and dark from the outside, adds privacy, but can still see out fine from the inside...can't believe how cheap I was able to re do 2 huge front window screens on amazon compared to what I would have paid, and the time I would have had to wait, 2 week delay...had this done in no time myself...DIY and save...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don't forget to order the spline too.
customer_reviews.text: Great screen, plenty to do a large window or standard door, but you will need to buy the spline. It is good to use the spline tool also for expert install.
customer_reviews.author: MCTD1966

customer_reviews.title: Cheap cat door
customer_reviews.text: I cut a square, attached the top to a cheap tension rod, and cut a slit down the middle. Put it in front of the window. Glued magnets to the bottom of the screen and the base of the windowsill. Now when the window is open, the cats can come and go as they please, and I can remove it and roll it up when I move.
customer_reviews.author: Robert L.

customer_reviews.title: Wasp's no more
customer_reviews.text: So, I purchased this because I have been getting wasp nests in my recessed outdoor lighting. With a little Elmer's glue and this screen cut to size... I have no more wasps. Genius!
customer_reviews.author: TNash

customer_reviews.title: Good mesh for screen repair.
customer_reviews.text: Bought several rools of this to redo all the screen on my house. Worked out great. Screen material is very forgiving to semi rough handling, and did not rip/tear at all. Newly renovated screens look very nice. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: TL

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: This was my first time doing it and I had to replace my torn screens to avoid being charged by my landlord. These looked and fit great, very easy to install - I bought 2 of them and took me about 1 hour total. You have to buy a spline roller to make the job easy.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel

customer_reviews.title: Vegetable Garden Sun Reducer
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to create a ‘roof’ for my vegetable garden as I live in Zone 10 and “full sun” is a bit too intense for seedlings and many tender veggies. It’s works great for filtering out partial sun. So far it seems to hold up well from the stretching and stapling.
customer_reviews.author: Jes

customer_reviews.title: a great product. Flexibility
customer_reviews.text: Wow, a great product. Flexibility, strength and color was exactly what I was looking for. I did a 12x20 foot deck in a day by myself and I am a 68 year old man. Was actually fun working with this screen. The price was less than half of the big box store. Don't be afraid to order this screen.
customer_reviews.author: Lonnie B. Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Doing screens yourself is such a huge cost savings
customer_reviews.text: This was a lot easier to do than I expected and I ended up doing every window in my house. The old ones had gotten a dull gray even whitish color and having fresh dark screens on the house makes the whole house look better even from the top of the street.
customer_reviews.author: LOU B.

customer_reviews.title: I would recommend.
customer_reviews.text: Very nice screen! I had to make some window screens for my new house as well as replace some screens and this is the third one I’ve worked with and I’m very pleased with this one. It is very durable! Easy to work with and the coloring is the same throughout the entire roll. This will be my go-to screen from now on. I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: H H

customer_reviews.title: IMPERFECTIONS ON SCREEN
customer_reviews.text: It does the job to keep away the bugs & mosquitoes from getting in, but we noticed these imperfections on the screen runs all the way up. (ON VIDEO) Therefore, it’s my OCD doing this review. Lol! We had already opened package & cut to size up screen to fit window, then we noticed these imperfections on the screen. The material does feel like it can rip easily, so we recommend that you handle with care.
customer_reviews.author: For Your Information (FYI)

customer_reviews.title: Look elsewhere
customer_reviews.text: I had already successfully done nearly every window on my entire home but needed a bit more for the last 2 screens. My local store was out so I ordered this. It tore on both windows and was also a dark charcoal instead of the gray I ordered. Very dissatisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey M Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Find another product elsewhere.
customer_reviews.text: Very poor quality control. Misshapen screen “grid” and elongated holes in screen, not your typical square grid. Very disappointed with this product.
customer_reviews.author: JeffS

customer_reviews.title: Best value for DIY screens
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to go with Prime-Line screen frame kit and spline. The fiberglass screen is really easy to cut and work with. We will see how it holds up with pets on the screen door, but it should be great for the windows.
customer_reviews.author: Ajoneil

customer_reviews.title: It's holding up great, water pouring through it and catching leaves and ...
customer_reviews.text: I used this for a DIY project, instead of its intended use. I mad covers for rain barrels, to keep leaves, bugs and other junk out, so the screening is being abused compared to what it was designed for. It's holding up great, water pouring through it and catching leaves and twigs. If it can hold up to this, I'm sure it would work well as a normal window screen.
customer_reviews.author: SteelSlicer

customer_reviews.title: Deters cat from escape
customer_reviews.text: Good Screens! My cats destroyed my old screens and I figured it would just be a matter of time before she clawed through these too. She tried a few times but gave up after awhile. I guess the strength of these was enough to deter her from escaping! Pretty excellent purchase!
customer_reviews.author: melinda

customer_reviews.title: It's screen
customer_reviews.text: It's screen, it's legit. There was nothing to dislike about it. Built this trap for horse and deer flys. Majestic.
customer_reviews.author: Colby

customer_reviews.title: Durable and see-through.
customer_reviews.text: Very see through once it's in the window. You can't tell it's there. Also, very durable.
customer_reviews.author: Share Jolliffe

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install. And I have a lot left over. I rent, and the tenant before me destroyed some things, and my landlord probably never noticed. I’m the type to just fix things myself instead of waiting for it to be fixed.
customer_reviews.author: Cheyanne

customer_reviews.title: Perfect amount, great price
customer_reviews.text: This was the perfect amount for my project and the best price that I could find. I was happy to not have to buy a giant roll when I only needed a minimal amount.
customer_reviews.author: StewCrew

customer_reviews.title: DIY screen repair
customer_reviews.text: This was perfect for my DIY back sliding door Screen replacement. It is so much sturdier than the old metal-like mesh screens. The puppies I foster shred the old stuff like Kleenex. This stuff holds up to tiny puppy toenails.
customer_reviews.author: sped prof

customer_reviews.title: Need to order another roll
customer_reviews.text: This was enough to cover 2 screen door windows. Unfortunately the grandkids pushed against it one time and out it ripped. Not sure if it is the material or user error. Will try another product that is more rigid.
customer_reviews.author: David Hill

customer_reviews.title: Good value for the money
customer_reviews.text: I was very happy with this screen. I ordered this in charcoal and was a just little surprised at how dark it is. I would have called it black. It came quickly and was more than enough screen for what I needed. Very easy to work with and I would definitely buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Low quality, tears easily
customer_reviews.text: Really low quality. It tore easily when you gently pressing it into the screen frame, other brands did not tear on same frames. Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Kaizen

customer_reviews.title: Good deal
customer_reviews.text: It's window screen. It was exactly what I expected. Now mosquitoes don't eat me alive every night anymore! I live it. Worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Cheap
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace the screens on my sunroom damaged by Hurricane Irma. It is very thin and see through as compared to my existing screens which hide the indoor view. I have to spend more money to match what was installed originally.
customer_reviews.author: frank

customer_reviews.title: Great Value!
customer_reviews.text: This was priced right -- had paid more for a much smaller roll of this material at HD -- same brand and everything. This material is great. I don't have to cringe anymore when I need to replace a screen that has seen better days!
customer_reviews.author: Frances Hunt

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy material, functional
customer_reviews.text: I bought a house that needed a little TLC. The Florida room has screened in windows all the way around. One of the screen was torn so I got this as a quick fix to put up until I can replace the window screen. I staple gunned it up around the window to keep out the Florida bugs, frogs, lizards, etc. Works good.
customer_reviews.author: AK

customer_reviews.title: still need more
customer_reviews.text: i used for my deck. i ordered more for the other side. i used the T50 staples and stapled on to the wood studs. at first i was afraid staples would break the net, but so far looks good.
customer_reviews.author: Dx

customer_reviews.title: Not that durable - only lasted a little over year and a half.
customer_reviews.text: The net is just as easy to install as any other for the most part however it only withstood a little over a year and a half of Southern California weather.
customer_reviews.author: ChrisP

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommend
customer_reviews.text: High-quality, easy to install. Used to a portion of our screened porch.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent screen
customer_reviews.text: Excellent screen I bought the product for screen replacement on my Lanai and Southwest Florida.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Keeps the flies out and is easy to sew on a regular machine
customer_reviews.text: I have sewn 3 door screens so far. 2 warehouse door screens and one entry door for our facility. Keeps the flies out and is easy to sew on a regular machine. I have enough to do my screens at home as well. Good product, prime delivery, definitely a value for my purposes. Would work great for a garage door too.
customer_reviews.author: P. Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Easy screen replacement after cat destroyed the last one
customer_reviews.text: We had to replace our screen after our cat had used it to get to an out of reach (actually what we assumed was out of reach) starling nest last year. It only took a few minutes to replace.
customer_reviews.author: Emma

customer_reviews.title: Just what was needed to change out a screen door
customer_reviews.text: The material seemed sturdy enough. For less than $10, it's priced right for DYI. I would buy it again if another screen door needs to be replaced.
customer_reviews.author: aultraman

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality.
customer_reviews.text: Quality product! I used this for my broken screens at home with ease. I also used this at work to keep birds out of our satellite dish. Very satisfied with the product.
customer_reviews.author: David Roman

customer_reviews.title: More than one use
customer_reviews.text: We live on the fourth floor of our apartment building. While we have a small balcony, we also have small dogs who could fit through the railing. The screening is being used to cover the railing. It is sturdy and looks nice.
customer_reviews.author: C. B. Hoosier

customer_reviews.title: This IS NOT black....it's gray so if you are wanting black ....don't buy it.
customer_reviews.text: It is fine for what it is but one of the other reviews said this looked black although it says gray.....no, it IS gray but if you aren't matching it up with other black screen it's fine. You will have to switch all of your screens if they are black because this one is gray unless it doesn't matter than by all means. I am just one of those folks that likes everything to match...lol.
customer_reviews.author: Iba

customer_reviews.title: One of the best products for its price!
customer_reviews.text: Well, I intended to use it as a false bottom barrier which what I bought it for and it works well and holds the substrate.Also, to a see the question, you can cut t with scissors and i may not have used I for it’s intended purpose, it works like a charm for what I used it. 10/10 would recomend again!
customer_reviews.author: Juan F. Blanco

customer_reviews.title: Needed to replace broken or missing screens. Used with screen kit from Amazon, EASY
customer_reviews.text: Needed to replace broken or missing screens. Used with screen kit from Amazon, EASY to install in screen kit.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie Smith

customer_reviews.title: Nice material
customer_reviews.text: Perfect to replace one screen door, our dog run through the old screen, and now we just spent a few minutes and got it fixed with this material. Very good quality and price.
customer_reviews.author: E.Kwan

customer_reviews.title: Good quality screen material
customer_reviews.text: I used this to rescreen a window and this seems to be a very good quality screen material. Soft and flexible, but strong enough not to tear when installing. I've had some other window screens tear when rolling them tight in the frame channels. No tears with this product. 25' roll is enough to do lots of windows.
customer_reviews.author: Geeman

customer_reviews.title: High quality perfect for my needs
customer_reviews.text: This screening material worked great for my needs. I actually needed something wider but the extra cost for the wider one was ridiculous so I purchased 2 and sewed them together. Made a large overhead shade for my patio for a fraction of the cost and is holding up really well to extreme heat and windy days
customer_reviews.author: D.T.

customer_reviews.title: i need more
customer_reviews.text: i used to shield my deck. this type of screen is easy to cut and i use the t50 stapled it to wood. i am buying more for the other sides of the deck.
customer_reviews.author: Dx

customer_reviews.title: The quality is decent
customer_reviews.text: It only have the screen without any installation kits or guides. Extra works are need to put it on. I use it to block my windows to prevent bugs getting in the house. However, I don’t know how there are still very small bugs get inside.
customer_reviews.author: YC

customer_reviews.title: I actually purchased this screen for the purpose of using ...
customer_reviews.text: I actually purchased this screen for the purpose of using it in the bottom of my plant pots for proper drainage..it was cheaper to purchase a roll I can cut and custom design for any size plant pots to protect the soil...purchased for this purpose not to use to rescreen any windows in my home...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product
customer_reviews.text: Very good product. I ordered 2 rolls because I wanted to see what type of product this was for replacing my screens and was very pleased with the result. I've just ordered 5 more rolls so I can complete all of my windows.
customer_reviews.author: pastalover

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Seems strong enough and was not bad to install for a first timer. We'll see about durability.
customer_reviews.author: BJ Neblett

customer_reviews.title: it's good and bad
customer_reviews.text: It's nice looking and better visibility and all ; but as soon as my tool hit on the net , it cut quickly , that's the point I am concerned about ..
customer_reviews.author: JL

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the unexpected projects
customer_reviews.text: Use this to cover the eaves inside of the shed so that no bees could get inside but airflow could still be maintained and it worked like a charm.
customer_reviews.author: SuzAnne

customer_reviews.title: Preventative anti-termite screen!
customer_reviews.text: Like many other reviewers, I use this for something other than it's advertised purpose- putting it over attic & garage vents to keep pests (mainly termites). It works great as an anti-termite screen- since they can't get through, they'll either go somewhere else, or at least stay out of the house & that alone can save you thousand$.
customer_reviews.author: T

customer_reviews.title: good quality and easy to work with
customer_reviews.text: replaced my screen door screen. it is dark colored so people tend to walk into it though...
customer_reviews.author: yang xing

customer_reviews.title: Wire for my porch
customer_reviews.text: The wire was just what I needed.i had to replace the wire on my back porch.it came quickly .i have already replaced all my screened on my porch I am well pleased.
customer_reviews.author: joankemp

customer_reviews.title: Nice sturdy screen
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I need, used them with the screen frame kit I purchased and everything worked as expected. Seems sturdy and should last a long time hopefully.
customer_reviews.author: John S

customer_reviews.title: Good Value
customer_reviews.text: Simple to install. Used a Prime-Line Products P 7505 – Spline Roller to install, also very good. The original spline was good for the reinstall. Cheap fix for a 16 year old window screen.
customer_reviews.author: Davitar

customer_reviews.title: I did all my screens in one day .
customer_reviews.text: This worked out well . Its vary easy to tare but with a little caution you will find its very easy to work with . I had to do 10 screens and I did them casually over one day . plus a few for my neighbor . Thanks it was easy .
customer_reviews.author: Joeb

customer_reviews.title: Cheaper than the Depot.
customer_reviews.text: Got this as an add on item for $3 bucks which I believe is a steal of a deal. It is indeed quality stuff. I got it cheaper then at the Depot so I’m happy.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Foy

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: Good replacement screen. Plenty left over for the next time I need to re-screen as well.
customer_reviews.author: Tek Spek

customer_reviews.title: Good ammo for a few years of battling cat and ...
customer_reviews.text: Good ammo for a few years of battling cat and kid abuse on screen doors and windows. Way cheaper than local vendors. Typical quality, haven't noticed any flaws.
customer_reviews.author: Kalani Nicholls

customer_reviews.title: Simple to install
customer_reviews.text: I was looking to replace an old ripped screen on the home we purchased. I found this screen to be a great price so i bought it. It was so simple to install.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Rather painless install
customer_reviews.text: Can't really say about durability but it was reasonable easy to install for a first timer, and fairly unobtrusive.
customer_reviews.author: Philippe Jeanty

customer_reviews.title: will buy again
customer_reviews.text: used it to make a screen on top of a lid for airflow. works perfectly nothing can get in nothing out.
customer_reviews.author: eli gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: Sweet!
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what we needed. Great deal/price. We recommend. NOTE:: be sure you have the stripping and the tool needed to properly replace your screen. It’s easy, but ya need those two things.
customer_reviews.author: LoftyLanaTruthTeller

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Good standard window screen. I'm sure my cats will eventually scratch it up but I have enough to re do it again
customer_reviews.author: Gary  Reiter

customer_reviews.title: Perfect color match and nice quality
customer_reviews.text: My cute pup rip out rv screen door... and I purchased this in hoping it will match.. it did great quality and perfect packaging.
customer_reviews.author: Luz

product_meta.title: ADFORS Standard Window Screen, 36 " x 84", Charcoal
product_meta.description:
Size Name:36" x 84"| Color:CharcoalADFORS Standard Window Screens are easy to install. They will not dent, crease, or unravel. Perfect for use in windows and doors; it will protect from insects and pests. ADFORS is leading the industry by offering a complete line of ortho-phthalate free screens. GREENGUARD Gold Certification that limits strict emissions during production and is designed for a healthy living space.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Flexible, economical and easy to install screening. Will not crease, dent or unravel. Withstands all climates and salt air. The most commonly used screening for new construction.
feature_bullets: Perfect for use in windows and doors
Will not dent, crease, or unravel
